items.author: Todd McCarthy
items.content: A gemlike picture crafted with rare and immaculate precision.

items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: Delicately subversive, hypnotically sardonic, full of terror, banality and wafer-thin lyricism.

items.author: Michael O'Sullivan
items.content: That rare cinematic experience-a movie so close to pure perfection that it seems a shame to spoil it by even reading a review beforehand.

items.author: Tom Keogh
items.content: Achieves a kind of beauty through its overlaying enigmas, and Carrey.

items.author: Richard Corliss
items.content: Hollywood's smartest media satire in years--and a breakthrough for Jim Carrey.

items.author: Elvis Mitchell
items.content: Warm, affecting and refreshingly shtickless, he (Carrey) occupies center stage here through sheer, beguiling force of personality.

items.author: Maitland McDonagh
items.content: A cool indictment of television's near-irresistible pandering to the inner peeping tom.

items.author: Jonathan Rosenbaum
items.content: Undeniably provocative and reasonably entertaining, The Truman Show is one of those high-concept movies whose concept is both clever and dumb.

items.author: Marjorie Baumgarten
items.content: It's unusually provocative and challenging for a Hollywood movie and, surprisingly, allows the audience to piece things together without too much external direction.
